intro: Mariscus gunnii var. novae-hollandiae, commonly known as the New Holland mariscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range in color from pink to purple. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and habitat preference, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in native Australian ecosystems.
